title: 111_hr3909
content: The "Renewable Energy Investment Act of 2009" includes provisions for extending renewable electricity production credit, expanding clean renewable energy bonds, extending investment tax credit for certain energy property, and increasing credit for investment in advanced energy facilities. The "Renewable Energy Investment Act of 2009" extends credits for alcohol fuels, biodiesel, and renewable diesel. It also includes provisions for research and development of fungible biofuels, renewable electricity production credit extension, and expansion of clean renewable energy bonds. The "Renewable Energy Investment Act of 2009" extends credits for alcohol fuels, biodiesel, and renewable diesel. It includes provisions for research and development of biofuels, renewable electricity production credit extension, and clean renewable energy bonds. Section 54C of the Act is amended to allocate an additional $500,000,000 for each year from 2011 to 2014, with a provision for zero allocation after 2014. Unused limitation can be carried over to the following year if the allocated amount exceeds the bonds issued. The amendments made by this section apply to bonds issued after December 31, 2010. The Investment Tax Credit for certain energy property is extended, with amendments for solar energy, fuel cell, small wind energy, and geothermal heat pump systems. The effective date applies to property placed in service after the enactment of the Act. Additionally, there is an increase in credit for investment in advanced energy facilities. SEC. 104 increases the credit for investment in advanced energy facilities from $2.3 billion to $4 billion. SEC. 201 extends credits for alcohol fuels from 2010 to 2011, with a conforming amendment for 2012. SEC. 202 extends credits for biodiesel and renewable diesel. SEC. 202 extends credits for biodiesel and renewable diesel from December 31, 2009, to December 31, 2011. The amendments apply to sales and uses after the enactment of this Act.
